title.narrative: Emergency WASH Assistance to new arrivals in MMC and Jere LGA of Borno State

description.narrative:
The last IOM Displacement Tracking Matrix round 25 October 2018 assessment report for 14 hotspot LGA’s, showed that 73% (1, 248, 809) of the total IDP’s were displaced due to armed conflict are in Borno State,40% of the IDP’s are residing in camp like settings, and 60% are in the host community of the 14 hotspot LGA’s
As at 10th January 2019 MMC had 234,045 IDP’s. There is a current influx of 25,261 new arrivals and a projection of 47,364 from 11 January to 1 April 2019. In Jere LGA, estimated IDPs stood at 55,824 as at 10th January, with a significant influx of new arrival of 2,337 and a projection of 4,382 IDP’s from 11 January to 1 April 2019.
Furthermore, the recent attack by the Non-State Armed Opposition Group had forced many families to flee communities around the Lake Chad Region. Based on the report of the allocation strategy and CAID coordination with the WASH Cluster and other WASH actors, there is an increasing WASH gap in MMC and Jere LGA. The existing WASH facilities and services are overstretched and proving inadequate to provide enough coverage to users in the camps.
Through the NHF fund, Christian Aid aims to provide life-saving relief interventions to conflict affected populations in Dalori and Gubio camps in MMC and Jere LGA’ of Borno State in North East Nigeria, focusing on new arrivals. The intervention will assist conflict affected populations in the 2 Borno Central LGA’s to meet their basic human needs of access to improved sanitation and hygiene facilities. Christian Aid is proposing to provide life-saving WASH services to newly arrived Internally Displace Person’s and meeting sectoral gaps over a period of 5 months, through an emergency WASH services provision at new arrival camps, and congested camps with high concentration of IDP’s located in MMC and Jere LGAs. The proposed WASH products/services will be delivered to a total of to 9800 new IDP arrivals in Dalori and Gubio camps in MMC and Jere LGAs. The following are the proposed activities.
1) Drilling of 2 hybrid powered boreholes in Dalori and Gubio new arrival camp to provide portable drinking water to conflict affected persons as per sector standard
2) Construction of 19 blocks of 4 and 2 stance of inclusive VIP latrines and bathing showers, 10 blocks of inclusive latrines and bathing showers will be constructed in Gubio camp, and 9 blocks of inclusive latrines and bathing showers will be constructed in Dalori camp for conflict affected new arrivals, to enable them have safe access to improved sanitation facilities.
The proposed set of activities prioritized under the 2019 First Reserve Allocation will directly reach 10,600 most vulnerable conflict affected individuals out of the 51,7467 incoming projected new arrivals in the most affected hotspot in Jere and MMC LGA’s in Borno State. Based on historical trend analysis as mentioned in the strategy paper.
